titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Gravesend history collection 1978.046
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-22 21:45:42 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: in one document box and one oversize folder.

did.abstract: This collection contains a 1686 charter for Gravesend signed by Governor Dongan; a 1741 indenture between Jacobus Stryker and Nicholas Stillwell; a circa 1891 land deed and title searches for property in Gravesend; and a manuscript copy of William H. Stillwell's "Annals of the Town of Gravesend."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Each document is housed in its own folder and the bound volume has a custom housing. The original indenture is in an oversize box but there are access photocopies with the rest of the collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Gravesend history collection, 1978.046, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: William Henry Stillwell manuscript on the history of Gravesend (1977.309)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a 1686 charter for Gravesend signed by Governor Dongan; a 1741 indenture between Jacobus Stryker and Nicholas Stillwell; a circa 1891 land deed and title searches for property in Gravesend; and a manuscript copy of William H. Stillwell's "Annals of the Town of Gravesend."

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
